results.content: Please, avoid this course at all costs. This course is meant for newcomers to JS, but it will lead you astray and teach you horrible practices. While technically the content is correct, it is outdated and horribly organized. The code looks incredibly unprofessional from its ugly syntax, horribles variable naming practices, and outdated principles. The instructor seems like a nice guy, but this course feels like it was copied and pasted from google to a script, and then that script was read and performed without actually knowing what was happening. Waste of money, please save yourself the time and take another course.

response.content:
Its would not be possible to gradually teach without introducing concepts and topics as the course progresses, and doing everything at once is not a good learning experience.
Please continue into the later lessons as I noticed you've only completed less than 1% of the course mainly the introduction which is meant for beginners to teach how to start using JavaScript.  To avoid confusion with the basics of programming it starts out simple.
The exercises are well planned out and progress to more difficult ones in a strategic learning approach.
The syntax is correct and you will notice that within the course I also use an addon to ensure the spacing, indents and white space are proper, there is a downside to having the bigger and more readable which has been requested by many students, and that is that more line length is needed and the wrap sometimes may make the code look out of line.  This is the trade off to more readable text on small screens, also naming is basic in the beginning such as using single characters because to learn JavaScript this is not the core focus of the learning experience and not the learning objective which is to teach coding!
The core fundamentals come first which need to be established then the course moves on to more complex topics and whats new with JavaScript.  If you need help I'm online and always happy to help and please do not get discouraged with learning JavaScript as you progress through the lessons it will come together and you will find the value in the many over 50 exercises building and applying JavaScript.

I only have a bit of criticism. On some of the section a bit more of an outline of what you want to achieve and how we are going to get there (so that it helps us break down the thought process), I would find this really helpful and then when you ask us to pause the video we would have a much clearer picture of what the goal is. Really good course worth every penny.

results.content: This is a very comprehensive course and took me eight months to complete doing an hour or two every day. I maximized the value by going off on tangents writing my own code in my own mini-projects as the course progressed. I also augmented the content by looking up and researching on the Internet particularly difficult topics to me such as callbacks. I have reasonable HTML and CSS and now feel competent to write very functional web pages with all the Javascript I have learned. Laurence Svekis the instructor is clearly well steeped in his subject and following along on his course was an enjoyable experience.

Thank you Laurence and Rob for making learning fun and productive!

For absolute beginners this course is strongly recommended - everything is explained very thoroughly.

For people who already have some JS knowledge this course is still okay, but some topics are to basic.

Cheers

results.content:
A good course with lots of good information. Definitely feel that I have a much better grasp of JS having taken this course compared to other web developer courses. 
Some things to note: The ES6 portion is just tacked on at the end of the course, almost as an afterthought. I feel that given how old ES6 is the ES6 syntax should really be included throughout the course to allow the learners to become more familiar with it and its uses. 
The final two sections (both making small applications) are fairly simple compared to the level of complexity learnt just previously in the course. I feel that the final project could include an API and more ES6 content such as the Promise which was quite briefly skimmed over.

After taking this course you will certainly be quite proficient in JavaScript. Will you be a Professional? I'm not so sure...

response.content: The ES6 is added at the end so that students can develop the fundamentals of JavaScript without confusion on versions and what works with which browser.   The projects are based on the lesson content so the end project would be done the same way based around the lesson content for that section.  There are challenges in each lesson to learn the particular learning objective.   If you need any help I'm always happy to help if I can in the Q&A section to clarify content and update content as needed.

results.content:
Being a longtime telecoms platforms engineer, and trying to build on my academic background which is heavily mathematics, information systems and solar energy systems management biased; I embarked recently on a plan to slowly but surely convert into a web based software application developer. 

I then discovered a key route to take : ''JavaScript and Udemy''...I searched million times which path and I must say this long course was a perfect answer. 

Using my good familiarity with OOP and some exposure to IDEs which are basically ''no-code'' based; I had some good culture before, but now after doing exercises, imagining and challenging myself further on personal projects thanks to this course,I really feel fired up on my way to building web based business solutions, because it is like something has been demystified. 

That said, the instructor has been so thorough in teaching concepts and so understanding in responding. I would recommend something:
to comment more the codes that come at the end a lecture, to give more project-like exercises and to ''up the game'' by getting industry based challenges like what IT departments in real life have to solve and build. Thank you Udemy and Laurence.

Michel

results.content:
If you are new to javascript and programming in general, then you will get a lot out of this course. The material in this course if fairly basic, but it will give you a solid starter foundation in javascript. There is quite a lot of repetition but it covers quite a lot of javascript. There is lots of lectures and sections but you often don't get as much out of the lectures as you like. 

Compare to some of the newer courses, this course feels a bit dated and is a bit dry. In summary, I would say this is a good starter course in javascript. Laurence is a very helpful instructor and responds to questions very quickly.

More real world projects would definitely improve the course. A section on node.js or react or d3.js would also make this course more relevant in 2018+.

results.content:
It was the most "boring" course I had so far!
I had previous knowledge of javascript and ready to learn more... but it was so hard to keep my eyes open while watching this course! 
I have been to other courses and read programming books from cover to cover (plus 600 pages) and I know I have no focus deficiency.. but there is something in the style of Laurence's presentation which is very monotone and boring.
I think Laurence embodies the stereotypical idea that we have about programmers and geeks! and that is frightening!
This is not to say that I haven't learned anything in this course, I did. but not much since I couldn't feel emotionally excited about it.
Also the course is too long and therefore, shallow! better to limit the topics and study them deeper.

response.content: Sorry to hear your feedback, the course is designed to have a lot of practice exercises and for beginners to start coding.  The pace is slower than most of my other courses as it goes into more detail than other courses

results.content: I`m half the way of this course and i must say that this course is very chaotic. Instructor is an great expert, but somethimes i have a feeling that he is just improvising. He`s jumping from one point to another without explaining what is going on. Sometimes he just does things without explaining what he did. Challenges are not very clear and sometimes i wasn`t sure what excactly i have to do. The stucture of a course is very repetetive. "Welcome back!", "So what i want you to do", "I hope you have an opportunity to try this out..." ;) I know its not a big deal, but when you listen this for few hours a day, might be irritating. Thats my opinion so far. Maybe when i finish the course, i`ll change my opinion.

It's a pretty good course that looks quite indepth of each area of javaScript, very useful if you go alone with him and make notes and really understand whats happening. 

The only complaint I would say I have is that he starts to talk about working with the DOM before he's even talked about if statements, which I feel is more fundemental and allows you to do a lot more with programming (luckily I already know the basics of if and else). Other than that though it's still a very useful course and obviously you can skip to whichever videos you want, I just think for the very new begginers learning about if and else is pretty fundamental :)
